{"step_by_step_thinking": "The deciduous mandibular first molar has five cusps: three buccal cusps and two lingual cusps. The highest (longest) and sharpest cusp on this tooth is typically the mesiolingual cusp. This cusp is located on the lingual side of the tooth, towards the mesial (front) aspect. Therefore, the answer is A. Mesiolingual.", "answer_choice": "A"}
